image.altText: Woman holding sign with kids and famer husband perched at the end of a stone work Orroroo Sign

props.synopsis: Almost two dozen regional councils in South Australia have banded together to share how childcare shortage is impacting parents living in their region.

title.children: The challenges of living in one of Australia's worst childcare deserts

image.altText: A packet of Little Dough Co. mini fruit hot cross buns.

props.synopsis: Food Standards Australia New Zealand issues a recall of a hot cross bun product it says is sold online and at Foodland supermarkets in South Australia.

title.children: Hot cross buns recalled at SA supermarkets because of glass hazard

image.altText: A large bin parked in a carpark outside a childcare facility

props.synopsis: The state regulator has said Genius Childcare can reopen with strict conditions following a 14-day closure over cleanliness allegations.

title.children: Childcare forced to temporarily close over 'smell' allegations allowed to reopen

image.altText: Patrick Reed in his follow through after hitting a fairway wood

props.synopsis: American Patrick Reed has been showered by the boisterous crowd at The Grange Golf Club's famed party hole, setting the scene for LIV Golf's weekend.

title.children: Patrick Reed hits a hole-in-one at LIV Golf Adelaide's famed party hole

image.altText: Jamie Cripps celebrates a goal for West Coast against Adelaide

props.synopsis: Dynamic pricing means AFL fans in Adelaide may pay double what they would pay for a general admission ticket at the MCG or Docklands Stadium, as the federal government considers feedback on plans to ban the practice.Â

title.children: Criticism of 'unfair' dynamic pricing prompts calls to standardise AFL tickets

image.altText: Lisa Cunningham

props.synopsis: Prosecutors will not seek the death penalty for a former South Australian woman awaiting trial in the United States over the death of her stepdaughter.

title.children: Death penalty dropped against SA woman awaiting trial over stepdaughter's death

image.altText: A photo of a woman with black and red hair stands outside in a garden with her arm around a young girl. They look concerned.

props.synopsis: Before the cost of living crisis, mother-of-five Bec Cocker used to shop at Australia's two major supermarkets, now she says she shops differently and relies on charities to keep costs down. Others say they bulk shop and grow their own herbs to help, as data shows prices are not coming down.Â

title.children: Aussie households share how they keep up with high grocery costs

image.altText: A collection of buildings at a steelworks.

props.synopsis: The Whyalla steelworks owner says it will sell part or all of its stake in a New South Wales coal mine and use some of the proceeds to "catch-up" on payments owed to suppliers.

title.children: Steelworks owner to sell stake in NSW coal mine to pay Whyalla suppliers

image.altText: A large standstone home. A large navy boat is in front of it.

props.synopsis: Coal miners are on paid leave at his mine in NSW and workers at his South Australian steelworks are facing an uncertain future, yet steel baron Sanjeev Gupta is about to renovate his $34 million Sydney home.

title.children: Whyalla faces uncertainty as owner gets approval for $34m mansion renovation

image.altText: A court build with a columned verandah and a blue coloured building behind

props.synopsis: A man who snatched a one-year-old from a pram on a bus in Adelaide's northern suburbs has been released from custody without further penalty after spending six months behind bars.Â

title.children: Man who snatched baby on SA bus released from custody

image.altText: ABC Adelaide Collinswood building. Photo taken Feb 13 2025.

props.synopsis: The ABC and South Australian government will investigate relocating the public broadcaster's Adelaide operations to a new central site, with plans to move in 2029.

title.children: ABC to move Adelaide operations out of landmark Collinswood building

image.altText: A man watching a computer screen of a cow being milked by a robot.

props.synopsis: 'Voluntary milking systems' â or robots â are not new to the industry, but it's hoped a significant uptake of the technology will entice the next generation of producers to stay in the industry.

title.children: Calm cows and a sleep in for dairy farmers who 'couldn't ask for anything better'

image.altText: Anita Kuss in a blazer smiling in a garden

props.synopsis: South Australia's largest seat only has two candidates as the federal election nears, with an independent joining the race.

title.children: Candidate's push for SA's largest seat turns contest into two-horse race

image.altText: A man standing with his arms folded, looking at another man who is sitting and speaking

props.synopsis: The US president promised to move quickly on his return to the White House, but the pace he's set in his first four weeks has still left many in Washington scrambling.

title.children: Donald Trump's information overload tells us a lot about his strategy

image.altText: A composite image of Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese, both wearing thick-rimmed glasses and looking stern.

props.synopsis: For once, in this parliament, it seemed the government was not just sitting like a hapless duck in the crosshairs of a question time attack.

title.children: Labor takes out its trash ahead of election and Albanese couldn't be happier

image.altText: A woman looking on with a neutral expression on her face.

props.synopsis: Russia's foreign ministry has criticised the ABC and its Four Corners program over its most recent report, which took audiences inside a Ukrainian drone unit fighting Vladimir Putin's forces.Â

title.children: Four Corners Ukraine report sparks angry Russian government response

image.altText: Shein

props.synopsis: Chinese fast fashion app Shein has relaunched in India almost five years after it was banned â some say it's a worrying move.

title.children: Asia's richest man brought Shein back to India â why was it banned?

image.altText: Carlindie homestead 1

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology has downgraded ex-tropical cyclone Zelia to below cyclone intensity but major flooding warnings in place remain in place in north-west WA as evacuations of remote communities begin. Follow live.

title.children: Cattle station badly damaged, community evacuated as ex-TC Zelia brings flooding

image.altText: nsw ambulance and two police officer hold up at green tarp outside a house in mayfield after officers tasered and shot a man

props.synopsis: A critical incident investigation is underway after a man, believed to be in his 40s, was tasered and shot by police at Mayfield, in the NSW Hunter region.

title.children: Man allegedly carrying meat cleaver tasered and shot by police

image.altText: A man on a plane connected to medical equipment

props.synopsis: Paul Boon considered himself generally fit and healthy before his first heart attack this year. The 54-year-old was enjoying the waves on his e-foil board when he felt intense pressure in his chest.

title.children: 'It escalated quickly': 54yo man warns others of heart attack signs

image.altText: Back of Helga Lam next to court justice scales

props.synopsis: The NSW government has agreed to pay $2.5 million in settlements to four men who allege they were sexually abused as teens by a female teacher who could not be criminally prosecuted because a historical charge does not apply to women.

title.children: Four men who allege they were abused by female teacher agree to $2.5m settlement

image.altText: Jay-z 2025

props.synopsis: Jay-Z said in a statement that today was a victory and "the trauma that my wife, my children, my loved ones and I have endured can never be dismissed."

title.children: 'Fictitious and appalling' rape allegations against Jay-Z dismissed

image.altText: a building with an orange sky

props.synopsis: Fire crews continues to battle the three major fires on Tasmania's west coast, but cooler temperatures and rainfall have allowed the downgrading of a number of warnings, including Corinna and surrounds.

title.children: Tasmanians urged to remain alert about the fires as 'weather changes very erratically'

image.altText: members of air crash investigation team in US examine parts of debris from Washington DC plane crash

props.synopsis: Preliminary analysis of voice recordings and other black box data recovered from the crash site showed the helicopter pilot and her instructor read aloud conflicting altitudes before the collision.Â

title.children: 'Bad data' possibly used by Black Hawk crew before Washington DC crash

image.altText: A female gorilla at Melbourne Zoo

props.synopsis: Vets at Melbourne Zoo are investigating the death of a 20-year-old gorilla named Kimya, who died on Saturday morning.

title.children: Melbourne Zoo investigating sudden death of gorilla

image.altText: Gout Gout gives the thumbs up after a 100m race at the Australian All School Championships.

props.synopsis: Gout Gout's manager James Templeton says he hopes the sprint prodigy's Stawell Gift debut will see his star rise higher in the eyes of the Australian public.

title.children: Gout Gout to raise profile and follow famous footsteps with Stawell Gift berth

image.altText: Bankstown Hospital nurses Ahmad Rashad Nadir, left, and Sarah Abu Lebdeh, right, leaning in to screen

props.synopsis: NSW Police have executed a search warrant on the Bankstown home of one the Sydney nurses who made threats towards Israeli patients, the same day a longer video of the interaction was released.Â

title.children: NSW Police execute search warrant on Sydney nurse's home

image.altText: idol's eye hero

props.synopsis: The pale blue stone has passed through the hands of royals, art collectors, sultans and aristocracy â but who does it belong to now?

title.children: The Idol's Eye diamond is just 2cm wide â and worth more than $27 million

image.altText: Don Farrell Labor caucus

props.synopsis: Don Farrell insisted he wanted to win the crossbench over to his electoral reform bill. They didn't believe him.

title.children: A quip from Don Farrell convinced crossbenchers they'd been 'stitched up'

image.altText: Matthew Kuhnemann speaks to Steve Smith during a cricket Test in Sri Lanka.

props.synopsis: Acting Australia captain Steve Smith says he is confident Matthew Kuhnemann will be cleared after his bowling action is reviewed by the International Cricket Council.

title.children: Steve Smith surprised Matthew Kuhnemann bowling action reported

image.altText: Interior of a Qantaslink regional aircraft.

props.synopsis: A human exchange on a flight reminded me that it is never too late to rediscover your ability to show compassion for others.Â

title.children: Kindness can hide in a polarised world but it is there if you look for it

image.altText: Two men in a field holding cameras

props.synopsis: Birdwatchers are pouring billions of dollars into Australia's tourism industry every year with calls to capitalise on the country's native species and better promote the pastime.

title.children: How birdwatching is taking flight as Australia's new tourism goldmine

image.altText: a red car is stuck in a mudslide while a man and a dog walk past

props.synopsis: A climate scientist has said that while the area of Southern California is desperate for rain, this storm might bring too much too quickly.

title.children: Southern California hit by mudslides weeks after devastating fire
